fields.summary: euca-describe-clouds has no output when using HA

fields.summary: euca-describe-clouds does not return anything in HA

comments.body:
HA on CentOS6 setup:

{code}
[root@eucahost-51-92 ~]# euca-describe-clouds --debug
2012-06-08 10:17:25,362 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:request_params: {}
2012-06-08 10:17:25,363 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Method: GET
2012-06-08 10:17:25,363 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Path: /services/Configuration/
2012-06-08 10:17:25,363 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Data: 
2012-06-08 10:17:25,363 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Headers: {}
2012-06-08 10:17:25,363 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Host: 192.168.51.92:8773
2012-06-08 10:17:25,363 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:establishing HTTP connection: kwargs={}
2012-06-08 10:17:25,363 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:using _calc_signature_2
2012-06-08 10:17:25,364 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:query string: AWSAccessKeyId=8GN4JLPQG4HLMTCRZDILY&Action=DescribeEucalyptus&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2012-06-08T17%3A17%3A25Z&Version=eucalyptus
2012-06-08 10:17:25,365 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:string_to_sign: GET
192.168.51.92:8773
/services/Configuration/
AWSAccessKeyId=8GN4JLPQG4HLMTCRZDILY&Action=DescribeEucalyptus&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2012-06-08T17%3A17%3A25Z&Version=eucalyptus
2012-06-08 10:17:25,365 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:len(b64)=44
2012-06-08 10:17:25,365 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:base64 encoded digest: WzPofEM+QEjRA9kG7nqsvAhZwPi42NTnCFvoiHBBNrM=
2012-06-08 10:17:25,365 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:query_string: AWSAccessKeyId=8GN4JLPQG4HLMTCRZDILY&Action=DescribeEucalyptus&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2012-06-08T17%3A17%3A25Z&Version=eucalyptus Signature: WzPofEM+QEjRA9kG7nqsvAhZwPi42NTnCFvoiHBBNrM=
send: 'GET /services/Configuration/?AWSAccessKeyId=8GN4JLPQG4HLMTCRZDILY&Action=DescribeEucalyptus&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2012-06-08T17%3A17%3A25Z&Version=eucalyptus&Signature=WzPofEM%2BQEjRA9kG7nqsvAhZwPi42NTnCFvoiHBBNrM%3D HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: 192.168.51.92:8773\r\nAccept-Encoding: identity\r\nContent-Length: 0\r\nUser-Agent: Boto/2.1.1 (linux2)\r\n\r\n'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n'
header: Content-Length: 363
header: Content-Type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8
2012-06-08 10:17:25,425 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:<euca:DescribeEucalyptusResponseType xmlns:euca="http://msgs.eucalyptus.com"><euca:DescribeComponentsResponseType><euca:ConfigurationMessage><euca:_return>true</euca:_return><euca:_services/><euca:_disabledServices/><euca:_notreadyServices/></euca:ConfigurationMessage><euca:registered/></euca:DescribeComponentsResponseType></euca:DescribeEucalyptusResponseType>
[root@eucahost-51-92 ~]# 
{code}

Not seeing this on my setup, but seeing it elsewhere...?

{code}
[root@eucahost-51-82 ~]# . eucarc
[root@eucahost-51-82 ~]# euca-describe-clouds 
CLOUDS	eucalyptus	192.168.51.82	192.168.51.82	DISABLED	{}
CLOUDS	eucalyptus	192.168.51.84	192.168.51.84	ENABLED	{}
[root@eucahost-51-82 ~]# cat /etc/redhat-release 
CentOS release 5.8 (Final)
[root@eucahost-51-82 ~]# yum info eucalyptus
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
Installed Packages
Name       : eucalyptus
Arch       : x86_64
Version    : 3.1.0
Release    : 0.0.2661.20120608gitbbb6ddce.13.el5
Size       : 2.2 M
Repo       : installed
Summary    : Elastic Utility Computing Architecture
URL        : http://www.eucalyptus.com
License    : GPLv3
Description: Eucalyptus is a service overlay that implements elastic computing
           : using existing resources. The goal of Eucalyptus is to allow sites
           : with existing clusters and server infrastructure to co-host an elastic
           : computing service that is interface-compatible with Amazon AWS.
           : 
           : This package contains the common parts; you will need to install at
           : least one of the cloud controller (cloud), cluster controller (cc),
           : node controller (nc), storage controller (sc), or walrus packages as well.
{code}

The CLC isn't returning a list of any components at all.

{code:xml}
<euca:DescribeEucalyptusResponseType xmlns:euca="http://msgs.eucalyptus.com">
    <euca:DescribeComponentsResponseType>
        <euca:ConfigurationMessage>
            <euca:_return>true</euca:_return><euca:_services/>
            <euca:_disabledServices/>
            <euca:_notreadyServices/>
        </euca:ConfigurationMessage>
        <euca:registered/>
    </euca:DescribeComponentsResponseType>
</euca:DescribeEucalyptusResponseType>
{code}

But the services look okay:

{code}
% euca-describe-services -T eucalyptus
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.51.91  	ENABLED   	829 	http://192.168.51.91:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.51.91/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.51.92  	DISABLED  	829 	http://192.168.51.92:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.51.92/
{code}

...so there's a workaround.

HA on Precise setup:

{code}
root@eucahost-51-67:~# euca-describe-clouds 
root@eucahost-51-67:~# euca-describe-clouds  --debug
2012-06-08 11:07:38,250 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:request_params: {}
2012-06-08 11:07:38,251 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Method: GET
2012-06-08 11:07:38,251 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Path: /services/Configuration/
2012-06-08 11:07:38,251 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Data: 
2012-06-08 11:07:38,251 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Headers: {}
2012-06-08 11:07:38,251 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Host: 192.168.51.67:8773
2012-06-08 11:07:38,251 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:establishing HTTP connection: kwargs={}
2012-06-08 11:07:38,251 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:Token: None
2012-06-08 11:07:38,251 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:using _calc_signature_2
2012-06-08 11:07:38,251 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:query string: AWSAccessKeyId=235CNA8OLVDIITSSZOSCO&Action=DescribeEucalyptus&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2012-06-08T18%3A07%3A38Z&Version=eucalyptus
2012-06-08 11:07:38,252 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:string_to_sign: GET
192.168.51.67:8773
/services/Configuration/
AWSAccessKeyId=235CNA8OLVDIITSSZOSCO&Action=DescribeEucalyptus&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2012-06-08T18%3A07%3A38Z&Version=eucalyptus
2012-06-08 11:07:38,252 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:len(b64)=44
2012-06-08 11:07:38,252 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:base64 encoded digest: S9FipKjVfvOY0clsPXKI9kAf4BCTYj2s23nPk+Ks8JY=
2012-06-08 11:07:38,252 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:query_string: AWSAccessKeyId=235CNA8OLVDIITSSZOSCO&Action=DescribeEucalyptus&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2012-06-08T18%3A07%3A38Z&Version=eucalyptus Signature: S9FipKjVfvOY0clsPXKI9kAf4BCTYj2s23nPk+Ks8JY=
send: 'GET /services/Configuration/?AWSAccessKeyId=235CNA8OLVDIITSSZOSCO&Action=DescribeEucalyptus&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2012-06-08T18%3A07%3A38Z&Version=eucalyptus&Signature=S9FipKjVfvOY0clsPXKI9kAf4BCTYj2s23nPk%2BKs8JY%3D HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: 192.168.51.67:8773\r\nAccept-Encoding: identity\r\nContent-Length: 0\r\nUser-Agent: Boto/2.2.2 (linux2)\r\n\r\n'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n'
header: Content-Length: 363
header: Content-Type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8
2012-06-08 11:07:38,302 DescribeEucalyptus [DEBUG]:<euca:DescribeEucalyptusResponseType xmlns:euca="http://msgs.eucalyptus.com"><euca:DescribeComponentsResponseType><euca:ConfigurationMessage><euca:_return>true</euca:_return><euca:_services/><euca:_disabledServices/><euca:_notreadyServices/></euca:ConfigurationMessage><euca:registered/></euca:DescribeComponentsResponseType></euca:DescribeEucalyptusResponseType>
{code}

It appears (I haven't verified this) that when the CLC fails over we delete the registration information from "eucalyptus_config.config_component_base".

When listing the services using "euca-describe-clouds" we are using the DB information, when using "euca-describe-services -T eucalyptus" the information is not from the DB.

The "missing" registration entry may have some impact on service initialization in the CLC (some steps may be skipped that would otherwise be run) and it may be possible to register additional clouds ("euca-register-cloud") beyond the usually enforced limit.

I think the administrative UI "Service Components" page will sometimes not list the DISABLED/NOT READY cloud controller if it is currently down (e.g. if the primary is restarted).

If you re-register the clouds you will see them listed again in the "euca-describe-clouds" output, at least until you fail over/back.
HA redesign will be evaluated in later releases of euca.
